jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

2768E7AC3F1E4216A82141A69B7681DF.description:
Discuss the meaning of the
Pledge of Allegiance.

863DE61550BE4AF4B35D93D69E210B9A.description:
State reasons why people
benefit from basic rights such
as freedom of speech.

2281B9CE9A9C4B13B6B5008B9A6BA304.description:
Describe how a holiday such
as Memorial Day represents
the idea of sacrifice to
preserve freedom.

5A09565CA5D54F49B39A5FED2D2B3F2E.description:
Identify important Church
holidays; be aware of the
liturgical calendar.

D21482CC448E4937A3FBC8140631DB07.description:
Describe how a holiday
represents the ideas of
freedom (e.g., Fourth of July,
Veteran's Day.

8BEDD499A861410BB90B288C2D1B7085.description:
Give examples of people
being honest and truthful
when working with others.

1B0C4C426DF840E5B70354AA9272436A.description:
Identify an example of
behavior that shows someone
showing good citizenship and
stewardship (e.g., being
honest when being
questioned, recycling, caring
for the environment).

F8C28ED362CE410585E3CF54B3400B8A.description: Understand the development of the United States political ideas and traditions. Understand the development of religious/spiritual aspects of the United States political ideas and traditions. Explain the history of the Catholic Church and its impact in human events. CSIS4            Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7            Value the significance and impact to the Catholic Church throughout history. CSDS5

535170391B634E49A0A2957B0FCC5B38.description:
Identify a product or artifact
that comes from another
country (e.g., food, toys).

9A96150A368F43499C45540C7FDBAC4E.description:
Tell about food from other
countries.

B463CAD17DB34485B0F15DA9A0846BA5.description:
Tell about a Catholic person
from another country or
culture (e.g., Mother Teresa).

54E2248E265B46DA8EA0AF37912799D5.description:
Tell about someone that
students have seen or met
(e.g., on television, in a book,
in the neighborhood) who
lives in another country.

211D28EE34F746B3B0757AF0D312325A.description: Understand United States foreign policy as it relates to other nations and international issues. Understand United States foreign policy as it relates to other nations and Catholic Church issues. Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7     Explain what is positive in the world, what needs to be changed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4

5533B6D454BF440E83FD0FB73B461126.description:
Recognize the responsibilities
of local government.

D0482D52C8964F41B585E61772AF86F4.description:
State the interests of students
and adults involved in a
school project (e.g., a fund
raising activity to buy and
build new playground
equipment for their school) or
service project (e.g., food
drive, clothing drive).

CB87B393FA0B4958A29AFD3CB936F5C6.description:
Identify a student, parent or
Church group that serves the
school.

1519123FE4C647A88BE59C911B45F4E7.description: Understand the roles and influences of individuals and interest groups in the political systems of Illinois, the United States, and other nations. Understand the roles and influences of individual Catholics and Catholic interest groups. Identify the differences among the values of various political systems and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7         Recognize how the central themes within the stories of important Catholic figures and saints repeat over time. CSIS6

32296AE92E7B43C28DA57B98430D8C3A.description:
Identify elected leaders (e.g.,
mayor, governor, president).

32E8E08E261F4B3CA80141B8D6C6B827.description:
Summarize the outcome of
classroom decision-making in
terms of what was decided by
the majority of the students.

B9566FAC7D624F2AA1C94932B7FB7D41.description:
List examples of responsible
student classroom behavior
and Church behavior (e.g.,
liturgical experiences).

5EE461A634394ACDB3B9BB12B658A14F.description:
Discuss situations in their
home, school and Church that
illustrates people being
responsible in their duties or
job.

153607D0E3E740998F3C6477AC0A96BD.description:
Understand election processes and responsibilities of citizens. Understand the election process and special responsibilities of Catholic citizens. Value and develop a love for the common good and our shared humanity, not just with those around us, but for those who have gone before
and those that will come after us. CSDS2            Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7

BCF795CA9BB5490C93E6985D26D97E1B.description:
Plan and/or participate in
service projects that help the
community.

8A9146A5F500498EBEEA688C3DA51AE2.description:
Identify important services
provided by local
governments to people (e.g.,
police, and fire protection,
parks departments); identify
important services provided
by Church groups.

D3E46A15FFF843A3A536CB217A3A467D.description:
Name the current Governor
of Illinois.

FD0F4C4C0A9941C1862DDBC3C1B11893.description:
Name the current President
of the United States.

1340492BFE66492EB4EAFFBB80E33F25.description:
Identify positions, roles, and
responsibilities of their local
government (mayor, police
chief, fire chief, justice of
the peace); identify roles of
the hierarchy of the Church.

A140959E180A48C4B7AA9CB95028D23F.description: Understand the structures and functions of the political systems of Illinois, the United States, and other nations. Understand the relationship of Church structure and functions to the structures and functions of the political systems of the United States and other nations. Understand what God does for humanity. CSIS3       Understand and explain the human condition and the role and dignity of man in God’s plan. CSIS8         Discuss how Church structure and function can assist man in the acquisition of values and virtues. CSIS12            Identify what is positive in the world, what needs to be transformed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4

9C16E2B5F33D45F59B1983CF40844FAC.description:
Identify why people need
governments and Church to
help organize or protect
people.

2517849B27AF494CA2DE1DCE172FCA96.description:
Give an example of how
governments and Church
help people live safely and
fairly.

5DD27930EEF74A04857EFAA2C5E4F66B.description:
Demonstrate examples of
honesty and fairness when
playing or working with
other students.

74C96199298A48B7B10948E78F78C41F.description:
Produce new rules that could
apply to students' lives at
home, school and Church.

0132E9704FF54F209E4480E77A40531B.description:
Explain why schools have
rules to help students learn
include spiritual and
religious reasons, e.g. God
wants all children to learn

E5C92C55F9DB4A1D84E35A297B4D85BE.description:
Name some of the benefits of
sharing and taking turns
during games and group
activities.

A57FC67455434863A1E0782B84D8CFCD.description:
Tell about some rules and
responsibilities that students
have in school to help
promote order and safety

CFA872BD30BA45C88C22661F172488BE.description: Understand and explain basic principles of the United States government. Understand the relationship of basic principles for the U.S. Government and the Catholic Church Government. Understand what God does for humanity. CSIS3         Understand and explain the human condition and the role and dignity of man in God’s plan. CSIS8

F0A508A4AD5541289D08565F243FE3F4.description: Understand political systems, with an emphasis on the United States. Understand the relationship of the Church and its systems to political systems of the United States.
